display_asset.caption: Americans named President Obama and Hillary Clinton as the most admired man and woman in the world.

summaries.body: Americans named President Obama and Hillary Clinton as their most admired man and woman, according to a Gallup poll. Donald Trump tied Pope Francis for second.

display_asset.caption: Pam Russell, left, and Linda Hart rescued a cat from Ms. Russell's house in Rowlett, Tex., on Sunday.
display_asset.credit: Nathan Hunsinger/The Dallas Morning News, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Storms across the U.S. have led to at least 43 deaths in several states. Here’s what you need to know as the harsh weather continues this week.

display_asset.credit: David James/Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures

summaries.body: “Star Wars: The Force Awakens” reached a global tally of more than $1 billion after taking in about $153.5 million at North American theaters in its second weekend.

display_asset.caption: Excavators during a rescue operation after a landslide buried buildings at an industrial park in Shenzhen, China.

summaries.body: Twelve people have been detained after the collapse of a debris dumpsite in southern China that left dozens missing, the police said.

display_asset.caption: The Zaro’s Bread Basket in the Parkchester neighborhood of the Bronx on Sunday, a day before it will close after nearly 56 years there.
display_asset.credit: Stephanie Keith for The New York Times

summaries.body: Customers are mourning the end of a Zaro's bakery that has been a fixture in a Bronx neighborhood for nearly 56 years. It closes on Monday night.
Muslims could outnumber Christians globally beyond the year 2070, data from the Pew Research Center reveals.

display_asset.caption: Argentina's new president, Mauricio Macri, whose devaluation of the peso has eroded salaries.

summaries.body: President Mauricio Macri’s economic changes are roiling Argentina, accentuating a divide and leading some to doubt whether he will be a change for the better.
Concerned about pollution, a town in Italy has banned pizza-making in wood-fired ovens unless restaurant owners install special air filters.
In a vote in Spain on Sunday, a far-left Catalan party split evenly over whether to keep Artur Mas as the leader of both Catalonia and its secessionist movement.

display_asset.caption: Steven Brajdic flying a drone at Drones Plus in Miami.
display_asset.credit: Ryan Stone for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Federal Aviation Administration's regulations on drones are starting to clash with stricter local laws that aim to protect privacy and public safety.

display_asset.caption: A century after Albert Einstein proposed that gravity could bend light, astronomers now rely on galaxies or even clusters of galaxies to magnify distant stars.
display_asset.credit: Produced by Jason Drakeford, Jonathan Corum and Dennis Overbye
display_asset.title: Out There | Einstein’s Telescope

summaries.body: A century after Albert Einstein proposed that gravity could bend light, astronomers now rely on galaxies or even clusters of galaxies to magnify distant stars.

display_asset.caption: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, right, greeted a man whom he had dissuaded from jumping off the Bosporus Bridge in Istanbul.

summaries.body: In a scene reminiscent of the movie "It's a Wonderful Life," Turkey's president persuaded a man from jumping off of a bridge, according to local news reports.

display_asset.caption: Timothy Peake, a British astronaut for the European Space Agency, prepared to board a spacecraft bound for the International Space Station on Dec. 15.

summaries.body: A British astronaut dialed a wrong number from space, tweeting an apology to “the lady I just called by mistake saying ‘Hello, is this planet Earth?’”
It's been a warm December for many parts of the U.S. Here are recipes for a 70-Degree Christmas collected by the editors of NYT Cooking.

display_asset.caption: 220 Central Park South, with cranes, is under construction. A triplex at the fast-selling building reportedly is in contract for $200 million.
display_asset.credit: Edward Caruso for The New York Times

summaries.body: It was a record year for New York City real estate, with wealthy buyers writing gargantuan checks for condos, co-ops and townhouses across the city.

display_asset.caption: Abdullah Kurdi, a Syrian refugee whose son drowned off Turkey this year, recorded a holiday message for Britain's Channel 4.

summaries.body: The father of a Syrian boy who drowned off Turkey recorded a Christmas message for Britain's Channel 4 TV station. Abdullah Kurdi asked the world to "open its doors."

display_asset.caption: An aerial view of Rio de Janeiro’s severely polluted Guanabara Bay, site of the sailing events during the 2016 Summer Olympics.

summaries.body: At sailing races, competitors are sounding the alarm about pollution and debris in the oceans, including concerns about the Olympics venues in Rio de Janeiro.

display_asset.caption: Nelson Management, the owner of the Lafayette Boynton Apartments in the Bronx, spent thousands of dollars for lights and other decorations in the complex’s four buildings.
display_asset.credit: Kirsten Luce for The New York Times

summaries.body: The owner of several mixed-income properties in New York spent $34,000 on holiday lights and decorations worthy of Fifth Avenue.
Columbia House is being revived as a record company that will specialize in vinyl-only deliveries.

display_asset.credit: Steffen Kugler/Press and Information Office of the German Federal Government

summaries.body: A teenage Palestinian asylum seeker who burst into tears when Chancellor Angela Merkel said she might be deported will be allowed to stay in Germany for another year.
Thousands of people in South Korea are choosing to spend some time enclosed in coffins while alive.

display_asset.caption: Janet Jackson did not disclose what type of surgery was causing her to postpone her remaining tour dates.

summaries.body: Janet Jackson has postponed the rest of her "Unbreakable" world tour because she needs surgery.

display_asset.caption: Robert Downey Jr. accepted the awards for “Iron Man 3,” at the People’s Choice Awards in Los Angeles in 2014.

summaries.body: The actor Robert Downey Jr. was pardoned by Gov. Jerry Brown of California on Christmas Eve for drug and weapons charges from 1996 that almost derailed his career.
An Idaho school worker who said she was fired for giving a free lunch to a hungry student can have her job back, thanks to social media. But she’s not sure she wants it.

display_asset.caption: From left, Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg and Linda Cardellini in “Daddy’s Home.”

summaries.body: "Daddy’s Home," a comedy starring Mark Wahlberg and Will Ferrell as a rival dad and stepfather, is "a lump of coal in your Christmas stocking," our movie reviewer writes.

display_asset.caption: This dog, believed to have once been a pet, was one of the survivors. Dozens of other dogs were drugged, shot and dumped in rural Arkansas.

summaries.body: After dozens of dogs were drugged, shot and left for dead in Arkansas last week, an $8,000 reward is being offered for tips to solve the crime.
A man was sentenced to prison time for having unprotected sex with three women without telling them he had H.I.V., his second time being imprisoned for the offense.

display_asset.caption: The rapper Tupac Shakur, shown in 1993, will be played by a newcomer, Demetrius Shipp Jr.

summaries.body: A new biopic about Tupac Shakur named after his 1996 double album “All Eyez on Me” has cast its central role. Demetrius Shipp Jr. will play the rapper.

display_asset.caption: The statue of Cecil Rhodes was removed from the University of Cape Town in April. At Oxford University, a petition and campaign to remove a similar monument to Rhodes has gained ground.

summaries.body: A statue of Cecil Rhodes at Oxford University has inspired a petition, protests and a debate about whether Britain’s colonial past should be judged by contemporary standards.

display_asset.caption: Vixen, a 2-year-old reindeer, and David Reiner as Santa Claus this week at Santa's Pit Stop at Z Arch Barn Farm in Easton, Pa. The farm has a herd of 10 reindeer.
display_asset.credit: Jessica Kourkounis for The New York Times

summaries.body: Reindeer rental businesses make nearly all of their revenue in the holiday season, supplying animals for festivals, photo shoots, parades and other events.
